intro: Dendrocnide kajewskii, commonly known as the Kajewskii stinging nettle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that produce a potent irritant, similar to other stinging nettles. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and undergrowth. Dendrocnide kajewskii is known for its small, greenish-white flowers and its ability to thrive in tropical climates.
